noun.description: The curing of a synthetic resin in advance of another process (especially curing at a higher temperature), sometimes as an unwanted effect.

verb.description: Of a synthetic resin: to undergo premature curing, so as to impede subsequent mechanical processing.
To cure (a synthetic resin) prior to another process, especially curing at a higher temperature.

origin: 1930s. From pre- + cure. Compare precuring, precure<br>1930s; earliest use found in Industrial and Engineering Chemistry. From pre- + cure.
